result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric P. Larson

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on December 5, 2022 at 10:45 am.

AMENDED. No contact with violent contact with victim(s): C.M.O.; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. Prints and photograph. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  10:01 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher. 
Defendant does not appear. 
Atty Russ Kort appears on behalf of defendant. 

Date and time set for bond modification; VRCW.  
Atty Kort states he has an authorization to act on behalf of defendant today; makes statement re: defendant's non-appearance. 
COURT addresses motion. 
Victim makes statement and requests no contact be modified. 
State has no objection.  

COURT grants bond modification; amend to NO VIOLENT contact with C.M.O., all other conditions remain the same. 

COURT orders defendant to sign bond no later than 8/05/22 at 4:30 p.m. 

Adj:  10:04 a.m.

Motion hearing on August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Final pre-trial on October 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury Trial on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
